H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H4209.def: = plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H5197.def: = process by which liquids flow in small drops

H5317.def: = virgin {L:honey<SDBH:דְּבַשׁ>}, dripping straight from the honeycomb; ≈ regarded as very desirable food of high quality

H2441.def: = upper part of mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body

H2509.def: = state in which an object has a relatively even and regular surface, free from perceptible projections or lumps or indentations; ≈ often associated with danger and insincerity

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

H3939.def: = a plant which may grow as large as a bush, with woolly green leaves, ◄ Artemisia herba-alba; ► the juice tastes bitter and can be poisonous; used as medicine; ≈ associated with injustice and suffering

H2299.def: = pertaining to having a thin cutting edge; ► in order to make it useful and effective as a tool; ≈ often associated with aggression and danger

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H6806.def: = action by which humans put one foot before the other in order to move forward; ≈ often used figuratively to denote someone's journey through life

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H6424.def: literally: to make level (a road or path for someone else); hence: = causative action by which deities allow humans to make their journey to life without major obstacles

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4570.def: = the impression left by a foot or shoe on the ground

H5128.def: = process by which objects move up and down or sideways

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H1935.def: = state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority

H312.def: = pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

H394.def: = pertaining to being without mercy towards humans and animals

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H6089.def: = action by which humans have to make a strong physical effort to complete a specific task, for one's own benefit or in service to another

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5237.def: = state in which something or someone is identified as different or strange from one's own perspective

H319.def: = pertaining to being located far behind other objects in a row, in a direction away from the spectator; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was with their backs facing the East, this term presupposes a westerly direction

H5098.def: = action by which an animal makes a deep inarticulate sound; ≈ usually regarded as menacing

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H7607.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H5006.def: = state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events, often caused by pride and contempt

H4175.def: = rain that falls from mid-October until early November; ► moistens the soil and makes it soft to facilitate plowing and sowing; ≈ regarded as a blessing from YHWH ({A:ABD})

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H3925.def: = process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

H4592.def: = small quantity of objects or substance

H5712.def: = a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H953.def: = a place where water wells up from an underground source

H5140.def: poetic term; = process by which liquids or odors move from one place to another

H875.def: = hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄  usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally-occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded  as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life

H4599.def: = an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of blessing

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H6388.def: = a body of flowing water, ◄ probably dug by humans

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H7339.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H905.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4726.def: = an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of life and well-being

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H158.def: = state of having a type of beauty that inspires feelings of affection in someone else

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H1717.def: = the pair of mammae on the chest of human females; ≈ only used in the context of sexual pleasure

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H7686.def: = action by which animals move about without apparent purpose or destination

H160.def: = affection between people, or between people and deities

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7686.def: = action by which animals move about without apparent purpose or destination

H2263.def: = action by which humans put their arms around someone else ► as a greeting, a sign of affection, or during love-making

H2436.def: = front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

H5237.def: = state in which something or someone is identified as different or strange from one's own perspective

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5227.def: = state in which an object is located on the other side of an object or area

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6424.def: literally: to make level (a road or path for someone else); hence: = causative action by which deities allow humans to make their journey to life without major obstacles

H4570.def: = the impression left by a foot or shoe on the ground

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H7686.def: = action by which animals move about without apparent purpose or destination

H200.def: = state of being regarded as foolish, ◄  because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper
